makers.displayname: Francisco de Herrera the Younger, called "El Mozo"
makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to Francisco de Herrera the Younger, called "El Mozo", Spanish, 1627–1685

texts.textentryhtml: Mathias Polakovits, Paris and New York, stamp lower right [Lugt 3561]

This drawing was attributed to Francisco de Herrera the Younger (1627-1685) when the museum acquired it, but comparisons show that this drawing's technique of using slashing hatchmarks is closer to that of Vincente Salvador Gómez, a Valencian school draftsman.

Adapted from: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).
texts.remarks: 2019-5-7; Adapted from: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).
